name: Usha Kiran Palace

reviews.text: Everybody in the Hotel is quite kind and gentle.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: Everything is clean and the restaurant is great. We have eaten outside as the interior has no air conditioning and is rather hot.
reviews.title: Balance of Luxury and Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shame that there are glasses - unmovable - dividing the dinning room from the outside.
reviews.title: Charmed!

reviews.text: The waiter was Mr Santosh who suggested us good Indian food.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay !!

reviews.text: The Housekeeping in charge at the moment was a young Mr Jasil Ponnachan who was very kind and attentive.
reviews.title: Show of Wealth of Indian Kings

reviews.text: We stayed the hotel for 2 night. Our room was really beautiful, we had a roya suite room, chand niwas. The room was well-decorated and beautiful surrounding. I love the bathroom and living area. We had a big terrace for only two suites rooms.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel, average service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our deal included breakfast and one meal, transport which I found very reasonable. Hotel has a beautiful swimming pool, garden. I also love the decorations and architecture of the hotel. They maintained well.
reviews.title: what a gem.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the service is not impressive. We ordered the drinks at the restaurant. Although there were nobody when we arrived, it took over 30 mins to bring us the drinks. If you want to have one thing in the restaurant, you have to ask 2-3 times till they get it right. Also housekeeping is talking to me too much. It was very clear that he wanted to have tips. I wish they left me alone and peace. They should manage their staff training better. It is really a shame for such a beautiful hotel. If they have well-trained staffs, this hotel worths much better.
reviews.title: beautiful heritage hotel

reviews.text: This season has many mosquitoes. If you are going now, you should bring some mosquito cream etc. Someone recommended to eat outside, however, it is too cold to eat when I was there. Maybe nice for lunch and breakfast.
reviews.title: Absolute value for Money

reviews.text: Also for the palace museum time is 10am-5pm. And the fort is closing around 5pm and it takes quite long time to see all. So it is better to go early in the morning.
reviews.title: Fabulous property....

reviews.text: Don't miss out on Gwalior if you are visiting Northern India - the fort is particularly interesting. And don't miss out on this hotel - again, a beautifully restored property now run by Taj Hotels. Our room was so big and luxuriously appointed we couldn't have asked for more. But it was the staff also who were so friendly and accommodating - to the extent that my daughter was in the kitchen getting lessons from chef on Indian food, a personal touch that made our stay so delightfu;/ Dinner was excellent and reasonably priced. Gardens were lovely to sit and have a drink before or after dinner.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: What can I say? Circa 5000INR a night so not really budget, but still cheper than some UK budget chains at about £62.50 a night including breakfast and taxes. I did take advantage of the reduction in price after the 1st of May (off season charges) which made the hotel better value than it would have been and found it cheaper booking directly through the Taj hotels website.
reviews.title: Beacause you're worth it......!

reviews.text: Built by the Maharajah of Gwalior for the visit of King George and Queen Mary it's a kind of mini palace, but still pretty amazing for all that. The restaurant is superb and there's live music most nights. There are indoor and outdoor dining facilities and the courtyard flanked by the reataurant and bar is magical in the evening. The room wasn't huge but the facilities were first rate (may bath was more like a small swimming pool) and the beds comfortable and boasting decent matrresses.
reviews.title: Luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not have been more helpful, well I suppose you'd expect that from a Taj property, but still, their ability to arrange anything at short notice was very much appreciated.
reviews.title: U'll love it

reviews.text: A very nice place to spend you weekend! The rooms we had got were huge and truly exemplified luxury! The bath tubs and toilets were redone and it was truly going back in time. A very well kept lawn greets you! When we had visited the hotel was undergoing a few renovations and hence there were a few things out of place. Service however is something that needs to improve. A bit too slow - possibly it is because of the location rather than the hotel group. Worth spending a couple of weekends every year at the place!
reviews.title: A bit of luxury in Gwalior!

reviews.text: Stayed here last week. I did stay here a few months back but didnt have a very good experience that time so was a little sceptical getting back here, The last time had nothing to do with service but you really need to get used to staying in a heritage hotel with rooms three times the rooms you are used to staying in !! this time around i requested for a smaller room and didnt want a football feild for a room. it was very nice. great service and a very good staff. its an amazingly well kept heritage hotel managed by Taj. The rooms are good and spacious and the staff very courteous. the bathrooms are huge and really very good. the foods also good.
reviews.title: Majestic Usha Kiran Palace

reviews.text: Usha kiran is part of the palace premises and was use as the guest house for the guests visiting the king.
reviews.title: A comfortable bit of history for a quick business trip

reviews.text: If you love heritage properties this is a very nice and well maintained property. You can stay here and spend one day at the main palace and the museum. Day two you can do the fort and some local shopping and stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: unique experience

reviews.text: There isnt much to do for the kids here so if you have very small kids it would be challenge as there isnt much they can do besides play on the lawn and use the swimming pool. The swimming pools also very nice and in great ambience.
reviews.title: Old-world charm

reviews.text: The conference facilities are average and not very great. Guess this hotel is more for the traveller and lesser for the business types for having meetings.
reviews.title: Review on Usha Kiran

description: Usha Kiran Palace has played host to the King of England and is now a heritage hotel. Set amidst 9 acres of beautifully landscaped lawns, this 120 year old regal palace, rich in history, is outfitted with artistic stone carvings and delicate filigree work. Conveniently located, the hotel has 40 beautiful rooms including Villas with private pool and suites, a dining room truly reminiscent of royalty, a Bar and the award winning Jiva Spa.
